blockFlowSection.title: Blockflow: sharding on BTC's proven foundations
blockFlowSection.description: Alephium is built on the BlockFlow algorithm which delivers efficient and practical UTXO sharding. Inspired by distributed computing models, it combines DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph) and sharding. Being much more lightweight than other sharding methods, BlockFlow also natively supports single-step cross shard transactions, making the Alephium UX as smooth as any single chain platform.
blockFlowSection.cardText: BlockFlow combines DAG and sharding to enable an efficient, secure and verifiable consensus algorithm.

polwSection.title: Proof of Less Work (PoLW)
polwSection.description: PoLW uses a clever combination of physical work and token economics to dynamically adjust the work required to mine new blocks, ensuring a reduced energy footprint compared to classic Nakamoto PoW mining.
polwSection.cardText: Blockchain's success ultimately depends on its sustainability.

smartContractSection.title: Smart contract design
smartContractSection.description: Alephium's smart contracts have been designed and implemented to be scalable, functional, practical with a focus on security and reduced state usage. Its stateful UTXO model combines the advantages of the UTXO model and the account model.
smartContractSection.cardText: A new programming paradigm for smart contracts and dApps.

vmsSection.title: Novel VM
vmsSection.description: Alephium uses a simple, safe and flexible virtual machine designed for dApps, and more specifically DeFi. Its dedicated VM leverages and improves on the UTXO model to address DeFiâ€™s security issues and execution bottleneck. Our VM focuses on contract security and IO performance. The key features are its first-class token system, multiple-caller contract and fine-grained execution model.
vmsSection.cardText: VMs can be a big bottleneck when it comes to Blockchain performances. Not on Alephium.
